system.description:
The ability to impress or persuade crowds by logic, eloquence, or charisma. This is something of a shortcut skill and highly discretionary; some players have more fun actually making speeches. The GM should always require an orating PC to define the audience; mobs may be stupider than individuals, but they cannot be persuaded to step off a cliff.

Oratory EML cannot exceed the orator's or the audience's EML in the Language being used.
